results.title: Australian wool textile industry
results.creator_credit: Australian Woollen and Worsted Manufacturers Association and Cine Service
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the processes involved in the manufacture of woollen and worsted fabrics. Shows sorting of wool according to length and thickness; scouring; carding; dyeing; drawing and spinning; weaving and finishing; also detection and mending of flaws in the finished material. Explains the work done by the machines involved in drawing, spinning and weaving, and compares English and French machines with those used in Australian factories. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian women: their history and achievements
results.brief_description: Australia’s women’s history from 1788 to the present has been a time of enormous change for Aboriginal women, Australian-born and migrant women, working-class and middleclass, in war time and in peace. This video explores the changes in the lives of these women throughout history - changes brought about by economic conditions, legislation, immigration, education, war, the pill and women’s liberation.

results.title: Australian women composers
results.brief_description: A feminist documentary about the struggles and triumphs of Australian women composers. Composers looked at include Margaret Sutherland, Helen Gifford and Anne Boyd.

results.title: Australian wine uncorked! A History of wine on film
results.brief_description: Introduced by Len Evans, former director of the wine bureau, this ScreenSound documentary utilises archival footage and film reels to illustrate the history of the wine industry in Australia. Reaching Australia’s shores with the first settlers, a solitary vine and a pool of European viticulture expertise, the wine industry in Australia has created a plethora of famous vineyards and growers such as Penfolds, Brown Brothers, Great Western, Wolf Blass, Haughtons and the Hunter and Barossa Valley regions. The film includes advertising campaigns, product innovations, feast and famine in the industry, transportation, packaging and scientific research. Features footage from the following films: “Wines of Australia”, “From grape to glass”. Narrated by Hugh McKenzie.

results.title: Australian war memorial
results.creator_credit: John Gray, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An overview of the Australian War Memorial in Canberra, the quiet cloisters within it and the pictures, exhibits, dioramas, paintings, models and objects of war which recall the battles fought by Australians. Features the paintings and models which depict the 1915 Anzac landings in Turkey.

results.title: Australian steel : progress in Port Kembla
results.brief_description: Iron and steel production at Port Kembla, N.S.W. is linked with quarrying limestone at Iron Monarch and Cockatoo Island, limestones at Marulan and coal mining. A documentary style explanation of processes , products and progression of iron and steel production and coal mining.

results.title: Australian notebook. No. 5
results.brief_description: Newsreel magazine containing the following items: 1. Albert Park Lake proves new attraction for weekend walkers 2. Agriculture Minister Chandler opens a tree-pruning demo at Burnley Horticultural Gardens 3. Labrador retrievers display ability in club trials at Templestowe 4. Fisheries and Game Department supervisors release 20,000 young trout in the Yarra River 5. Sports brief - Lacrosse at Malvern, hockey with Camberwell v Power House for Altona Cup.

results.title: Australian Notebook. No. 2
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine contains historical items of Victorian history including: Country fire fighters in annual event at Chelsea; Veteran cars in rally - Melbourne/Brighton time trial; Ancient petrol rail car service in Melbourne suburb, Vic Rail introduce new suburban train - Blue Train; St Kilda-Brighton Electric tramway celebrates 50 years service.
